p: The 2002 South African adaptation of the SRPS was conducted among a cohort of rural youth in the province of Gauteng, and based off of a scale that was originally validated and adapted in the US in 2000 among a cohort of mainly Latina women [ 11]. It is likely that relationship dynamics are quite different today in a more urban setting than they were among young people in rural settings over a decade ago. The shifting ways in SRP equity plays out in young people’s relationships may be why a number of items did not load well onto the latent SRP equity variable in our study. In testing the reliability of the gender specific scales, we found higher reliability among the scale for young men. However, despite improved factor loadings of items following EFAs the Cronbach’s alphas of scales for both young men and women were moderate at best.
